5.description: If this stream (initially in the idle state) is initiated by the server, as described in Section 5.1.1, then receiving a HEADERS frame MUST also be treated as a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

6.description: An endpoint MUST NOT send any type of frame other than HEADERS, RST_STREAM, or PRIORITY in the reserved (local) state.

7.description: If an endpoint receives additional frames, other than WINDOW_UPDATE, PRIORITY, or RST_STREAM, for a stream that is in the half-closed (remote) state, it MUST respond with a stream error (Section 5.4.2) of type STREAM_CLOSED.

8.description: Values greater than 16,384 MUST NOT be sent unless receiver has set larger SETTINGS_MAX_FRAME_SIZE

9.description: The frame type determines the format and semantics of the frame. Implementations MUST ignore and discard frames of unknown types.

10.description: A reserved 1-bit field. The semantics of this bit are undefined, and the bit MUST remain unset (0x00) when sending and MUST be ignored when receiving.

11.description: Streams initiated by a client MUST use odd-numbered stream identifiers.

12.description: Streams initiated by a server MUST use even-numbered stream identifiers.

13.description: The identifier of a newly established stream MUST be numerically greater than all streams that the initiating endpoint has opened or reserved.

14.description: An endpoint MUST NOT send a RST_STREAM in response to a RST_STREAM frame

16.description: After receiving a RST_STREAM on a stream, the receiver MUST NOT send additional frames for that stream, except for PRIORITY

17.description: If a RST_STREAM frame is received with a stream identifier of 0x00, the recipient MUST treat this as a connection error (Section 5.4.1) of type PROTOCOL_ERROR.

18.description: When set, the ACK flag indicates that this frame acknowledges receipt and application of the peer's SETTINGS frame. When this bit is set, the frame payload of the SETTINGS frame MUST be empty.

23.description: A server MUST NOT explicitly set this value (SETTINGS_ENABLE_PUSH) to 1. A server MAY choose to omit this setting (SETTINGS_ENABLE_PUSH) when it sends a SETTINGS frame, but if a server does include a value, it MUST be 0.

24.description: A server MUST NOT send a PUSH_PROMISE frame if it receives the SETTINGS_ENABLE_PUSH (0x02) parameter set to a value of 0.
